cluster_relations.rel_desc: Oral storytelling facilitates the intergenerational transmission of tales.
Interconnected societies facilitate the spread of urban legends.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: became more interconnected through trade and travel

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The internet enables rapid sharing and dissemination of stories.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: In the age of the internet

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Social media platforms enable rapid sharing of stories.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: In the age of â€¦ social media

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject enables or makes easier the spread, transmission, or dissemination of the object (stories, tales, legends, or similar informational content).
args.justification: All four relations describe an enabling/causal role where the subject (oral storytelling, interconnected societies, internet, social media) makes it easier for stories, tales, or legends to be transmitted or spread. A single predicate 'facilitates_spread_of' captures this causal-enabling semantics consistently across instances without overfitting to a specific medium or speed.

Each subject entity functions as a mechanism or context that enables the dissemination of narrative or informational content. Grouping them under 'information_dissemination_enabler_relation' captures the shared conceptual family of relations where something acts as an enabler of information spread.

The relations all encode that the presence or operation of the subject causally contributes to or enables the spread/transmission of the object; this is best modeled as a causal/enabling dimension rather than mere association.
